title: Device Request - [Wall Switch 1 Gang] - [MOES] / [_TZ3000_bzzgvet0]
Device Request - [4 Gang Wall Remote] - [_TZ3000_5tqxpine] / [TS0044]
Device Request - [Motion sensor with Temperature & Humidity] - [HOBEIAN] / [ZG-204ZV]
Bug report - pls add missing writeInteger in TuyaSpecificClusterDevice.js
body:
### Describe the bug

I am using Smart water timer and it stopped working and I got error when I wanted to control this device few months ago, but I did not have time to investigate. I have identified issue now, It seems that someone wrongly deleted in library _TuyaSpecificClusterDevice.js_  definition of "writeInteger" datapoint and value. Could you just please restore "async writeInteger" ? 

### To Reproduce

Steps to identify error:

1. Go to TuyaSpecificClusterDevice.js  (https://github.com/eelco2k/com.tuya.zigbee/tree/f63c956857404d56cabcb2bfde30f716356e1979/lib )
2. Search for writeInteger and please restore part which was wrongly deleted.
3. Why writeInteger? Because in device.js in https://github.com/eelco2k/com.tuya.zigbee/tree/f63c956857404d56cabcb2bfde30f716356e1979/drivers/smart_water_timer is using it and I am getting an error when I want to control Smart Water Timer.
4. then pls reinstall com.tuya.zigbee App
5. If no error could you please update it for everyone?

### App and Homey version

> * What Homey version are you running? Homey Pro (Early 2023) 12.5.2
> * What version of Homey firmware do you use? 12.5.2
> * What version of the Tuya Zigbee App are you using? 0.2.73 Development

title: Device Request - Smart Plug - _TZ3000_iiacqpdz / TS011F
fix(repo): Rsolution dfinitive du conflit par recration de la branche
body:
### Problme : Le Paradoxe du Workflow (Catch-22)

Le workflow GitHub Actions sur la branche `powered-by-julesAI-2025` est bloqu dans un tat de conflit insoluble.

1.  **Le workflow actuel est dfectueux** : Il tente une opration `git rebase` qui choue systmatiquement  cause de conflits profonds avec le dpt `upstream`.
2.  **La correction est bloque** : Toute tentative de pousser un commit pour corriger le fichier de workflow dclenche le workflow dfectueux. Celui-ci choue avant mme que la correction ne puisse tre applique.

Le workflow se sabote lui-mme, empchant toute mise  jour.

### Solution : Contournement et Recration Manuelle

Pour briser ce cycle, la branche `powered-by-julesAI-2025` doit tre supprime et recre manuellement sur GitHub  partir d'une source saine. Cette action n'est pas un commit et ne dclenchera donc pas le workflow dfectueux.

**tapes de la rsolution :**
1.  Une nouvelle branche saine (`jules-final-fix`) a t cre localement.
2.  Cette branche contient le workflow final "auto-rparateur", capable de grer les futures synchronisations.
3.  La branche `powered-by-julesAI-2025` sera supprime de GitHub.
4.  Une nouvelle branche `powered-by-julesAI-2025` sera cre  partir de `jules-final-fix`.

Cette procdure garantit que la branche est saine et contient un workflow fonctionnel ds sa cration.

title: fix(workflow): Rsolution finale des conflits de rebase persistants
body:
### Problme

Le workflow GitHub Actions choue systmatiquement  cause de conflits de `git rebase` avec le dpt `upstream`. Les tentatives de correction via des scripts locaux n'ont pas russi  mettre  jour le fichier de workflow sur GitHub, entranant des checs rpts.

### Solution

Le contenu du fichier `.github/workflows/tuya-zigbee-auto-contributions.yml` a t remplac manuellement par une version corrige et robuste.

#### Changements cls :
- **Suppression du Rebase :** L'tape de synchronisation (`Sync with Upstream`) a t modifie pour ne faire qu'un `git fetch` sans tenter de `rebase` ou de `merge`. C'est l'action principale qui rsout le conflit.
- **Utilisation d'un PAT :** Le workflow utilise maintenant un Personal Access Token (`secrets.MY_PAT`) pour toutes les oprations Git et API, afin d'viter les problmes de permissions.
- **Amlioration du Dbogage :** Des commandes `echo` ont t ajoutes  chaque tape pour permettre un suivi clair de l'excution dans les logs.
- **Commit et Push scuriss :** La logique de commit a t amliore pour ne s'excuter que si des changements rels sont dtects.

title: Device Request  Roller Blind Motor  _TZE204_ahwvlkpy / TS0601
body:
Prerequisites:
Before requesting a device addition, please ensure there is not already a request for the device among the open issues.

Make sure your Homey is upgraded to firmware v5 or higher.

You need a physical example of the device.

Device Information
Device Name: Tuya Zigbee Roller Blind Motor

Device Model: TS0601

Device Description: Zigbee 3.0 tubemotor for roller blinds (EYA25G-WF), controllable via up/stop/down. Often used for DIY blinds and curtains.

Link to device image: https://www.aliexpress.com/item/1005007184765210.html

Device Interview
json
Kopiren
Bewerken
{
  "ids": {
    "modelId": "TS0601",
    "manufacturerName": "_TZE204_ahwvlkpy"
  },
  "endpoints": {
    "1": {
      "clusters": {
        "input": [
          "genBasic",
          "genTime",
          "genPowerCfg",
          "genIdentify",
          "manuSpecificTuya"
        ],
        "output": [
          "genOta"
        ]
      },
      "bindings": []
    }
  },
  "manufacturerName": "_TZE204_ahwvlkpy",
  "modelId": "TS0601",
  "applicationVersion": 70,
  "zclVersion": 3,
  "hardwareVersion": 1,
  "dateCode": "20210916",
  "powerSource": "DC Source",
  "softwareBuildId": ""
}
Additional Comments:
This is a Tuya Zigbee 3.0 roller blind motor (EYA25G-WF) purchased via AliExpress:
https://www.aliexpress.com/item/1005007184765210.html

It pairs with Homey but is added as an "Unknown Zigbee Device". Please add support under the cover (blinds) driver, similar to other TS0601 motors.

Thanks for the great work and for maintaining the Tuya Zigbee app!

How to interview a device
Add the device as a generic Zigbee device in Homey

Navigate to https://developer.athom.com/tools/zigbee

Interview the device using the  button

Click the copy icon to capture the device info

Paste the copied JSON in the section above

To be able to add more devices to the Tuya Zigbee app, we rely on community members like you to provide interviews of the devices you want to be added. Thank you for your contribution!

Device Request  Motion Sensor  _TZ3000_o4mkahkc / TS0202
body:
### Prerequisites:

- Before requesting a device addition, please ensure there is not already a request for the device among the open issues.
- Make sure your Homey is upgraded to firmware v5 or higher.
- You need a physical example of the device.

### Device Information

- Device Name: _TZ3000_o4mkahkc
- Device Model: TS0202
- Device Description: Tuya Zigbee PIR motion sensor. Battery-powered (CR2450), wall- or ceiling-mountable, sends motion events and sometimes tamper or battery status.
- Link to device image: https://nl.aliexpress.com/item/1005007862729814.html?spm=a2g0o.order_list.order_list_main.16.5fe179d2wHavE6&gatewayAdapt=glo2nld#nav-specification

### Device Interview

```json
{
  "ids": {
    "modelId": "TS0202",
    "manufacturerName": "_TZ3000_o4mkahkc"
  },
  "endpoints": {
    "1": {
      "clusters": {
        "input": [
          "genBasic",
          "genPowerCfg",
          "msOccupancySensing",
          "genIdentify"
        ],
        "output": [
          "genOta"
        ]
      },
      "bindings": [
        {
          "cluster": "genPowerCfg",
          "target": {
            "endpoint": 1,
            "ieeeAddress": "0x00158d000xxxxx",
            "type": "endpoint"
          }
        }
      ]
    }
  },
  "manufacturerName": "_TZ3000_o4mkahkc",
  "modelId": "TS0202",
  "applicationVersion": 66,
  "zclVersion": 3,
  "hardwareVersion": 1,
  "dateCode": "20220101",
  "powerSource": "Battery",
  "softwareBuildId": "1.0.6"
}
```

### Additional Comments:

> **Note: I bought the device via AliExpress:
https://nl.aliexpress.com/item/1005007862729814.html?spm=a2g0o.order_list.order_list_main.16.5fe179d2wHavE6&gatewayAdapt=glo2nld#nav-specification

This is a very common Tuya PIR motion sensor (TS0202 variant), but not yet matched by the current app. Its detected as an unknown Zigbee device in Homey (even with the test version of the Tuya Zigbee app). Would love to have this added.

Thanks in advance!

### How to interview a device

- Add the device as a generic Zigbee device in Homey
- Navigate to https://developer.athom.com/tools/zigbee.
- Interview the device, the button for this is to the right of the device in the list of Zigbee units.
- Click the copy button/icon to capture the device information.
- Paste the copied information above.

> **Note:** To be able to add more devices to the Tuya Zigbee app, we rely on community members like you to provide interviews of the devices you want to be added. Thank you for your contribution!

title: Bug report - [Short description]
body:
### Describe the bug

The soil sensor device _TZE284_aao3yzhs shows completely incorrect values for both humidity and temperature (67109121% and 67109120C respectively), and battery information is not displayed at all. The device appears to be using the Tuya proprietary cluster format but the current driver is trying to interpret the data as standard Zigbee values, resulting in corrupted readings.

### To Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to 'Homey App'  'Devices'  'Add Device'
2. Select 'Tuya Zigbee' app
3. Choose 'Soil Sensor' (first option under soil sensors)
4. Pair the _TZE284_aao3yzhs device
5. View the device card in Homey
6. See incorrect values: Luftfuktighet: 67109121%, Temperatur: 67109120C, Battery: no data

### Expected behavior

The device should display:
- Realistic soil moisture percentage (0-100%)
- Realistic temperature readings in Celsius
- Battery percentage or voltage information
- Proper battery alarm functionality when battery is low

### App and Homey version

- Homey Pro with firmware 7.4.2-0
- Tuya Zigbee App version v0.2.73Test

###

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f9f5b76f-1bca-455a-a33d-be03824ab9c7)

![Soil Sensor showing incorrect values](user-provided-screenshot-showing-67109121-percent-humidity-and-67109120-celsius-temperature)

The screenshot shows the device card displaying:
- Luftfuktighet: 67109121%
- Temperatur: 67109120C  
- Batteri: (no data shown)
- Batterialarm: (no data shown)

### Additional context

- Device manufacturer/model: _TZE284_aao3yzhs (soil moisture sensor)
- This is a Tuya device that likely uses the proprietary Tuya cluster (0xEF00/61184) for data transmission
- The values 67109120/67109121 (0x04000000/0x04000001 in hex) suggest raw Tuya cluster data being misinterpreted as standard Zigbee values
- Device paired successfully but was automatically assigned to existing "Soil Sensor" driver which doesn't properly handle this specific manufacturer variant
- This is the first Tuya device being tested in this Homey setup
- Diagnostic ID available: d424bf60-018c-4bea-acff-0ff80c363c67
- The device requires specific driver support for _TZE284_aao3yzhs to properly decode Tuya proprietary data format

Addition of Garage Door Controller and combined Fan on/off, fan speed, Light on/off drivers.
body:
Sorry Johan I could not make it splitting in to PR somehow. I am not totally friends with git yet.
Good that chatgpt is around, otherwise it would have taken some time I think:-).

These 2 drivers are orthogonal except for that the garage door controller has a new Tuya datapoint and the fan/light switch has a new flow card to be able to set the fan speed, but also to be able to display the speed set on the device tile.
The garage door controller I model as a lock to be able to display in the device tile if the door is open or closed.

The 2 new tuya devices I have added support for are:

fan_light_switch_tuya: TS0601_TZE204_lawxy9e2
garage_door_controller: TS0601 _TZE204_nklqjk62

```json
    ],
    "deviceType": "router",
    "receiveWhenIdle": true,
    "swBuildId": "600+TZZUT11HH102",
    "capabilities": {
      "alternatePANCoordinator": false,
      "deviceType": true,
      "powerSourceMains": true,
      "receiveWhenIdle": true,
      "security": false,
      "allocateAddress": true
    },
    "extendedEndpointDescriptors": {
      "1": {
        "clusters": {
          "basic": {
            "attributes": "UNSUP_GENERAL_COMMAND",
            "commandsGenerated": "UNSUP_GENERAL_COMMAND",
            "commandsReceived": "UNSUP_GENERAL_COMMAND"
          },
          "groups": {
            "attributes": "UNSUP_GENERAL_COMMAND",
            "commandsGenerated": "UNSUP_GENERAL_COMMAND",
            "commandsReceived": "UNSUP_GENERAL_COMMAND"
          },
          "scenes": {
            "attributes": "UNSUP_GENERAL_COMMAND",
            "commandsGenerated": "UNSUP_GENERAL_COMMAND",
            "commandsReceived": "UNSUP_GENERAL_COMMAND"
          }
        },
        "bindings": {}
      }
    }
  }
}
```

### Additional Comments:

> **Note:** Provide any other relevant information or requests related to the device. Link to where you bought the device can be of help

### How to interview a device

- Add the device as a generic Zigbee device in Homey
- Navigate to https://developer.athom.com/tools/zigbee.
- Interview the device, the button for this is to the right of the device in the list of Zigbee units.
- Click the copy button/icon to capture the device information.
- Paste the copied information above.

> **Note:** To be able to add more devices to the Tuya Zigbee app, we rely on community members like you to provide interviews of the devices you want to be added. Thank you for your contribution!

title: Device Request - Mi-Light / T0202 TZ0304
body:
Device Type: PIR Sensor
Sensors: Motion sensor, light/brightness sensor
Powered by tuya
Protocol: ZigBee 3.0
ModelName: PIR1-ZB
There are different Brands: Mi-Light, MiBoxer, LIGHTEU

After connecting the device to Homey as generic ZigBee device the following is shown in the device`s settings:
ManufacturerID: TZ3040
productID: _TZ3040_wqmtjsyk

It seems that it is a Tuya T0202 TZ3040 device.

I tried the Homey-App "Tuya ZigBee" which supports a device which looks like this. Unfortuanetelly Homey tells me that it is an unknown device.

HomeAssist did also some implementation work. Maybe this helps.

It would be great if you can add the device to the supported ones.
Thanks!

title: Device Request - Radar Sensor - _TZE204_nbkshs6k / 	TS0601

Device Request - Two Gang Switch - MOES / TS0012 _TZ3000_18ejxno0
[door window sensor] - [Ewelink] - [SNZB-04] [with interview]
1 gang wall by chevolink _TZ3000_5ftkaulg
_TZ3000_iszegwpd	TS0046
body:
Hi,

this wall switch (_TZ3000_iszegwpd | TS0046) also features Long press, but I cannot select that.

Can this be altered/added as feature?

Thanks

Robin

title: Device Request - Zigbee 1CH TH Smart Switch - _TZ3218_7fiyo3kv / TS000F
Device Request - Zigbee Temperature & Humidity Sensor Color  -TZE284_vvmbj46n/TS0601
Device Request - Temperature-Humidity- TZ3000_akqdg6g7 / TS0201
Device Request - [MOES Smart Scene Switch 4Button Wireless] - [_TZ3000_kfu8zapd] / [TS0044]~
Device Request - [1-Channel Relay Board] - [_TZ3000_p26flek3]- [TS0001]
Add EweLink Tuya (SQ510A) water leak detector
body:
Added eWelink water sensor (designation is SQ510A).
However for some reason it recognised as SNZB-03.
Reference with this issue for Z2MQTT:
https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee2mqtt/issues/24141

Technically it also a Tuya device due to hardware inside.

title: Device Request - [Door-Windows sensor] - [eWeLink] / [SNZB-04]
body:
### Prerequisites:

- Before requesting a device addition, please ensure there is not already a request for the device among the open issues.
- Make sure your Homey is upgraded to firmware v5 or higher.
- You need a physical example of the device.

### Device Information

- Device Name: Door/Window Sensor
- Device Model: eWeLink - SNZB-04
- Device Description: Door/Window Sensor
- Describe in short the functionality of the device: checks if door is open or closed
- Link to device image: https://a.aliexpress.com/_EHQQgfA

### Device Interview

```json
{
    ["Paste the device interview information here"]
}
```

### Additional Comments:

> **Note:** Provide any other relevant information or requests related to the device. Link to where you bought the device can be of help

### How to interview a device

- Add the device as a generic Zigbee device in Homey
- Navigate to https://developer.athom.com/tools/zigbee.
- Interview the device, the button for this is to the right of the device in the list of Zigbee units.
- Click the copy button/icon to capture the device information.
- Paste the copied information above.

> **Note:** To be able to add more devices to the Tuya Zigbee app, we rely on community members like you to provide interviews of the devices you want to be added. Thank you for your contribution!
